title: Cream Cheese Frosting
source: Smitten Kitchen Every Day - Deb Perelman
categories: Smitten Kitchen Every Day - Deb Perelman
ingredients: 4ounces (half an 8-ounce package/115 grams) cream cheese, softened
4tablespoons (2 ounces or 55 grams) unsalted butter, at room temperature
⅔cup (80 grams) powdered sugar (sifted if lumpy)
A pinch of fine sea salt (optional)
directions: make the frosting in a food processor Place the frosting ingredients in a food processor and run the machine to mix. Scrape down the bowl, then process for another 1 to 2 minutes, just until smooth and somewhat fluffed.

make the frosting with a hand or stand mixer Beat the cream cheese, butter, powdered sugar, and salt, if using, in a large bowl with electric beaters (for a hand mixer) or a paddle attachment, not the whisk (for a stand mixer), until fluffy. Drizzle in the milk and vanilla, beat until combined, then 1 more minute to whip it further.
